main event: On December 13, 1956, at Hamilton AFB, California, a spherical object with intense blue-white light was sighted directly overhead, tracking at approximately 270 degrees. The nature of the object was classified as possibly ballistic, a missile, balloon, aircraft, or astronomical, with inconclusive results due to insufficient data for evaluation.
interesting points: The spherical object had intense blue-white light and was tracked at 270 degrees from the observer's location.
The sighting was made by Alvin Haas, a Captain and aircrew member of the 25th Air Division, at Hamilton AFB.
The duration of the light from the object was 4 seconds, and it followed a straight-line flight path at approximately 37 degrees.
There was no corroborating evidence from local flight facilities, and the report was prepared by an officer on the day with no preliminary analysis.
The nature of the object was classified as possibly ballistic, a missile, balloon, aircraft, or astronomical, leading to an inconclusive assessment due to insufficient data.
sighted object: spherical object with intense blue-white light
witnesses: Alvin Haas, Captain and aircrew member of the 25th Air Division
photographs: no, the report does not include photographs
